intro: Parietaria prostrata, commonly known as匍匐地锦, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and rocky crevices. The plant features small, alternate leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are inconspicuous, appearing in clusters and producing tiny, wind-pollinated seeds. Parietaria prostrata is often found growing on walls and in damp soil, showcasing its adaptability to various substrates.
